sortalg

mergesort_ls.c File Reference

Detailed Description

Sorts an array of lsystem structures, according to a specified comparator function, by using the Mergesort algorithm.

Most parts of this code was obtained from
http://www.cprogramming.com/tutorial/computersciencetheory/mergesort.html

Author:
Farhan Ahammed (faha3615@mail.usyd.edu.au)

Definition in file mergesort_ls.c.

#include "mergesort_ls.h"

Function Documentation

void merge_helper ( datatype *  input,
int  left,
int  right,
datatype *  scratch,
int(*)(datatype *, datatype *)  cmp 
)

Helper function to sort the array.

Parameters:
input The array (of iterated_function_system structures) to sort.
left The index of the leftmost element of the subarray.
right One past the index of the rightmost element.
scratch An array of the same length as input.
cmp A pointer to a comparator function which compares two datatypes (iterated_function_system structures).

Sorts the array in increasing order and returns true (1) if successful.

Parameters:
input The array (of iterated_function_system structures) to sort.
size The size of the array input.
cmp A pointer to a comparator function which compares two datatypes (iterated_function_system structures).
Returns:
true (1) if the array was successfully sorted.
